intro: Hazardia squarrosa, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Hazardia squarrosa is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
